facts: A parable is a short story that uses everyday life to teach a spiritual lesson.
Jesus often taught in parables so people could remember big ideas through simple images like seeds, sheep, and coins.
The Parable of the Good Samaritan teaches that being a neighbor means showing kindness even to someone very different from you.
The Parable of the Prodigal Son highlights forgiveness and welcoming someone back after they have made mistakes.
In the Parable of the Sower, different kinds of soil represent different ways people respond to a message.
Some parables, like the Lost Sheep and the Lost Coin, show that every person is valuable and worth seeking.
Parables can have more than one meaning, and Jesus sometimes explained them to his disciples to help them understand the deeper lesson.
sources_hint: You can verify these facts in the Gospels of Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John in the New Testament.
